name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. William Joseph NOLAN, Appellant

judges: Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO and NEWMAN, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. William Joseph NOLAN, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
The appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Barry H. Dyller, Wilkes Barre, for appellant.
Peter Paul Olszewski, Jr., Wilkes Barre, Melissa A. Berlot, Nanticoke, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
699 A.2d 731
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. William Joseph NOLAN, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Submitted Sept. 26, 1996.
Decided Sept. 18, 1997.
Barry H. Dyller, Wilkes Barre, for appellant.
Peter Paul Olszewski, Jr., Wilkes Barre, Melissa A. Berlot, Nanticoke, for appellee.
Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO and NEWMAN, JJ.
